36.title: "Stay Away from Talking Frogs"
36.author: George J
36.appears_in: Lockwood. p. 34-40 in Cartoonist Profiles, no. 109 (Mar. 1996).
notes: Retired editor of Milwaukee Journal reminisces about the strips and panels he bought for his paper, with samples and comments about 12 of them: Conrad, The Far Side, Herman, Calvin and Hobbes, Hagar, The Circus of P.T. Bimbo, For Better or For Worse, Garfield, Terry and the Pirates, Mother Goose & Grimm, The Muppets, and Shoe.

37.heading: Garfield--Miscellanea.

37.author: [No author]

38.heading: Garfield--Miscellanea.
38.title: "Young or Old, What's the Difference?"
38.author: by R
38.appears_in: C. Harvey. p. 105-109 in The Comics Journal, no. 205 (June 1998).
notes: (Comicopia)

Examines Hilary Price's "Rhymes with Orange," Aaron Warner's "Adventures of Aaron," Rich Moyer's "ick," Frank Cho's "Liberty Meadows," Mark O'Hare's "Citizen Dog," Patrick McDonnell's "Mutts," Jim Davis's "Garfield," and Mike Peters "Mother Goose and Grimm."

notes: Takeoffs on The Far Side, Peanuts, The Katzenjammer Kids, Garfield, Blondie, Doonesbury, Cathy, and The Family Circus, used to make points about communication in management.

160.title: Garfield's Pet Force ; no. 1 The Outrageous Origin
160.author: created by Jim Davis ; character development by Mark Acey & Gary Barker ; written by Michael Teitelbaum ; illustrated by Gary Barker & Larry Fentz.
notes: (Garfield's Pet Force ; no. 1)
Funny animal fiction.

Summary: "Four ordinary pets (Garfield, Odie, Arlene, and Nermal) and one ordinary teddy bear (Pooky) are enjoying a typical afternoon eating hot dogs, trading insults, and reading comics. Everything seems perfectly normal. Meanwhile, a nearby universe is threatened by an evil veterinarian known as Vetvix, who wants to make all pets her slaves."

162.title: Garfield's Pet Force ; no. 5 Attack of the Lethal Lizards

notes: (Garfield's Pet Force ; no. 5)

Summary: On the far-off planet Reptilius, a swamp is zapped with a blast of magical energy. From the swamp, three lizards emerge to discover they have superpowers. The lizards are determined to take over the universe.
Funny animal fiction.
